result.execSummary:
The defendant Trista M Hrabak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Taycheedah Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Joint and several with Ian S and Robert M.

AMENDED 9/10/15:  RESTITUTION ORDER FILED SETTING RESTITUTION AT ZERO.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with the Raven Family.
Must have no contact with Tiffany W or her children.
Must have no contact with Ian S.
Must have no contact with Robert M.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages or controlled substances.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

03/13/15 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT MAY NOT HAVE CONTACT WITH THE RAVEN FAMILY. THIS NO CONTACT CONDITION DOES NOT APPLY TO MS. HRABAK'S CHILDREN.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

State moves to amend the charge to Party to the Crime 1st Degree Reckless Homicide. 939.05 - 940.02(1) a class B felony.  Court grants amendment. 
Defense relates. Defendant pleads guilty.The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.

Court questions State.  
Court relates.  Attorney Hinde requests bond be held in trust.  Attorney O'Boyle requests entire amount is Ms. Hrabak's.  

Court takes under advisement.  Brief to be filed by State in one week, Defense reply briefs due one week therafter and State's reply brief one week afterwards.  Decision to be provided one week thereafter.
